definition[0]: to give something to each person in a group
example[0]: Can you give the drinks out, please?
example[1]: Students were giving out leaflets to everyone on the street.
definition[1]: if part of your body gives out, it stops working properly or becomes much weaker
example[2]: Just as I approached the town, my legs finally gave out.
definition[2]: if a supply of something gives out, there is none left
example[3]: My money was beginning to give out and there were no jobs to be found.
example[4]: After two hours her patience gave out.
definition[3]: to produce something such as light, heat, or a signal
example[5]: A gas lamp gave out a pale yellowish light.
example[6]: It was given out that the government was to enter into negotiations with the rebels.
